bibl.title: Counting the People in Hellenistic Egypt. Volume I: Population Registers (P. Count); - Volume 2: Historical Studies. (Cambridge Classical Studies.)
bibl.note: tabl., figg., 5 pll.; - xxii-395 pp., 72 tabl., 24 diagrammes, 2 cartes.

Volume I: P. Count 1-54. (Re-)edition of various tax records, household records and tax-collection registers (Demotic and Greek), mainly from P. Petrie III and C.P.R. XIII. Third-second century BC. - Volume II: 1. Ptolemies, taxes and papyri; - 2. The census; - 3. The salt-tax and other taxes; - 4. Settlement in the Fayum; - 5. The people counted; - 6. Counting the animals; - 7. Family matters; - 8. Naming the people; - 9. Conclusion; - Appendix: Salt-tax registers and logeutic records: a classification. - Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: CLARYSSE Willy and Dorothy J. THOMPSON, in collaboration with Ulrich LUFT, Basil MANDILARAS, Günter POETHKE, Reinhold SCHOLL and John TAIT, Counting the People in Hellenistic Egypt. Volume I: Population Registers (P. Count); - Volume 2: Historical Studies. (Cambridge Classical Studies.)
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2006, 8°, xxvi-694 pp., tabl., figg., 5 pll.; - xxii-395 pp., 72 tabl., 24 diagrammes, 2 cartes. ISBN 0-521-83838-X; - 0-521-83839-8. £120; - 65.

Volume I: P. Count 1-54. (Re-)edition of various tax records, household records and tax-collection registers (Demotic and Greek), mainly from P. Petrie III and C.P.R. XIII. Third-second century BC. - Volume II: 1. Ptolemies, taxes and papyri; - 2. The census; - 3. The salt-tax and other taxes; - 4. Settlement in the Fayum; - 5. The people counted; - 6. Counting the animals; - 7. Family matters; - 8. Naming the people; - 9. Conclusion; - Appendix: Salt-tax registers and logeutic records: a classification. - Bibliography. Index.

C.R. par Dominic Rathbone, JHS 127 (2007) pp. 186-187. - Nicola Reggiani, EtCl 74 (2006) pp. 395-398. - Jean A. Straus, AntCl 77 (2008) pp. 613-614. - Anne-Emmanuelle Veïsse, Topoi 15 (2007) pp. 687-694. - Cary J. Martin, JEA 95 (2009) pp. 273-281. - Kai Ruffing, MBAH 27 (2009) pp. 227-236.
Clarysse Thompson Luft Mandilaras Poethke Scholl Tait
